data.title: A Year of Garbage Movies #1: “Disaster Movie” (2008)
data.meta_description: Per the rules that I set for myself back in January, I technically don’t have to do one of these for “Disaster Movie”, as I’ve already seen it. That said, I didn’t spend all year on this masochistic…
data.text:
Well, we’ve finally made it to the summit of the trash-heap.

Per the rules that I set for myself back in January, I technically don’t have to do one of these for “Disaster Movie”, as I’ve already seen it. That said, I didn’t spend all year on this masochistic enterprise to NOT rant about the worst movie on the list. Trust me; there’s plenty of rant fuel.

It should not come as a surprise to anyone that this is another one of Seltzer and Friedberg’s cinematic abortions, delivering about as many laughs as a real abortion. What might be surprising is that this isn’t the only film they released that year. “Meet the Spartans” preceded it by a few months, and made about twice as much money at the box office. In this instance, the ratio of profitability between the two movies is fairly reflective of the comparative quality of the films.

Earlier this year I had to watch “Meet the Spartans”. As I recall, I had to get a root canal that same day. I distinctly remember pausing the movie and thinking “Thank God, time to get that dead nerve sucked out of my mouth. Maybe I can convince them to staple my lower lip over my eyes while we’re at it”. “Disaster Movie” manages to be twice as bad. Every frame validates its place as the worst movie of all time. Even the title portends what you’re about to suffer through, like…
